meanings.definition: To move or transfer to a new station or location.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was restationed to a base in another state.
meanings.sent2: The company restationed their employees to the new office building.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was restationed to the warmer side of the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The migrating birds restationed themselves to a more suitable habitat.
meanings.sent5: The train conductor restationed the locomotive for maintenance purposes.

meanings.definition: To assign or place at a different station or location.
meanings.sent1: The manager restationed the security guard to the front entrance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher restationed the students to different desks for group work.
meanings.sent3: The chef restationed the spices closer to the cooking area for convenience.
meanings.sent4: The librarian restationed the books to a newly organized shelf.
meanings.sent5: The coach restationed the players to optimize team performance.
